articles.title: Hacker steals over $120 million from Balancer DeFi crypto protocol
articles.summary: The Balancer Protocol announced that hackers had targeted its v2 pools, with losses reportedly estimated to be more than $128 million. [...]

articles.title: Fake Solidity VSCode extension on Open VSX backdoors developers
articles.summary: A remote access trojan dubbed SleepyDuck, and disguised as the well-known Solidity extension in the Open VSX open-source registry, uses an Ethereum smart contract to establish a communication channel with the attacker. [...]

articles.title: Microsoft: SesameOp malware abuses OpenAI Assistants API in attacks
articles.summary: Microsoft security researchers have discovered a new backdoor malware that uses the OpenAI Assistants API as a covert command-and-control channel. [...]

articles.title: Malicious VSX Extension "SleepyDuck" Uses Ethereum to Keep Its Command Server Alive
articles.summary:
Cybersecurity researchers have flagged a new malicious extension in the Open VSX registry that harbors a remote access trojan called SleepyDuck.

articles.title: US cybersecurity experts indicted for BlackCat ransomware attacks
articles.summary: Three former employees of cybersecurity incident response companies DigitalMint and Sygnia have been indicted for allegedly hacking the networks of five U.S. companies in BlackCat (ALPHV) ransomware attacks between May 2023 and November 2023. [...]

articles.title: Hackers use RMM tools to breach freighters and steal cargo shipments
articles.summary: Threat actors are targeting freight brokers and trucking carriers with malicious links and emails to deploy remote monitoring and management tools (RMMs) that enable them to hijack cargo and steal physical goods. [...]

articles.title: Microsoft: Patch for WSUS flaw disabled Windows Server hotpatching
articles.summary: An out-of-band (OOB) security update that patches an actively exploited Windows Server Update Service (WSUS) vulnerability has broken hotpatching on some Windows Server 2025 devices. [...]

articles.title: OAuth Device Code Phishing: Azure vs. Google Compared
articles.summary: Device code phishing abuses the OAuth device flow, and Google and Azure produce strikingly different attack surfaces. Register for Huntress Labs' Live Hack to learn about attack techniques, defensive tactics, and get an Identity Security Assessment. [...]

articles.title: Cybercriminals Exploit Remote Monitoring Tools to Infiltrate Logistics and Freight Networks
articles.summary:

articles.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: Lazarus Hits Web3, Intel/AMD TEEs Cracked, Dark Web Leak Tool & More
articles.summary:

articles.summary:

Gen Digital, which disclosed details of the activity, did not reveal any details on when the

articles.title: Microsoft: Windows Task Manager won’t quit after KB5067036 update
articles.summary: Microsoft has confirmed a known issue that is preventing users from quitting the Windows 11 Task Manager after installing the October 2025 optional update. [...]

articles.title: Penn hacker claims to have stolen 1.2 million donor records in data breach
articles.summary: A hacker has taken responsibility for last week's University of Pennsylvania "We got hacked" email incident, saying it was a far more extensive breach that exposed data on 1.2 million donors and internal documents. [...]

articles.summary:

articles.title: Open VSX rotates access tokens used in supply-chain malware attack
articles.summary: The Open VSX registry rotated access tokens after they were accidentally leaked by developers in public repositories and allowed threat actors to publish malicious extensions in an attempted supply-chain attack. [...]

articles.title: OpenAI is going Meta route, as it considers memory-based ads on ChatGPT
articles.summary: OpenAI is planning to introduce ads on ChatGPT, as it continues to struggle with revenue from paid users. [...]

articles.title: A New Security Layer for macOS Takes Aim at Admin Errors Before Hackers Do
articles.summary:

articles.title: Russian Ransomware Gangs Weaponize Open-Source AdaptixC2 for Advanced Attacks
articles.summary:
The open-source command-and-control (C2) framework known as AdaptixC2 is being used by a growing number of threat actors, some of whom are related to Russian ransomware gangs.
AdaptixC2 is an emerging extensible post-exploitation and adversarial emulation framework designed for penetration testing.

articles.title: DDoS Botnet Aisuru Blankets US ISPs in Record DDoS
articles.summary: The world's largest and most disruptive botnet is now drawing a majority of its firepower from compromised Internet-of-Things (IoT) devices hosted on U.S. Internet providers like AT&T, Comcast and Verizon, new evidence suggests. Experts say the heavy concentration of infected devices at U.S. pr

articles.title: ShinyHunters Wage Broad Corporate Extortion Spree
articles.summary: A cybercriminal group that used voice phishing attacks to siphon more than a billion records from Salesforce customers earlier this year has launched a website that threatens to publish data stolen from dozens of Fortune 500 firms if they refuse to pay a ransom. The group also claimed responsibility
